definitions.definition: To subject to distillation.
To undergo or be produced by distillation.
To make by means of distillation, especially whisky.
To exude in small drops.
definitions.example: Firs distil resin.

definitions.definition: To impart in small quantities.
To extract the essence of; concentrate; purify.
To trickle down or fall in small drops; ooze out.
To be manifested gently or gradually.
To drip or be wet with.
A firm branch of a tree.
definitions.example: When the bough breaks, the cradle will fall.

definitions.definition: The gallows.
The first existence of anything; act or fact of commencing
definitions.example: The time of Henry VII nearly coincides with the commencement of what is termed modern history.

definitions.definition: The day when degrees are conferred by colleges and universities upon students and others.
A graduation ceremony, from a school, college or university.
An exceptionally good-looking and sexually attractive person, particularly a young man.
definitions.example: My new fella is such a dreamboat. He can dance, can sing, and is the captain of the school hockey team.

definitions.definition: Anything considered highly desirable for its kind.
definitions.example: My new car is a dreamboat.

definitions.definition: A type of fully automatic firearm that fires bullets in rapid succession by a single action of the trigger and is capable of sustained fire.
A place of residence for people who require constant nursing care and have significant deficiencies with activities of daily living, such as the elderly and younger adults with physical disabilities.
An animal such as a horse that has a coat of a dark base color with individual white hairs mixed in.
The color of such an animal.
A kind of leather used for slippers, bookbinding, etc., made from sheepskin, tanned with sumac and colored to imitate ungrained morocco.
Especially of a horse, having a coat of a dark base color with individual white hairs mixed in
Made of the leather called roan.
definitions.example: roan binding

definitions.definition: Sorbus aucuparia, the European rowan.
Any of various small deciduous trees or shrubs of genus Sorbus, belonging to the rose family, with pinnate leaves, corymbs of white flowers, and usually with orange-red berries.
Hair or wool of a sheep or similar animal
Insulating skin with the wool attached
A textile similar to velvet, but with a longer pile that gives it a softness and a higher sheen.
An insulating wooly jacket
(roofing) Mat or felts composed of fibers, sometimes used as a membrane backer.
Any soft woolly covering resembling a fleece.
The fine web of cotton or wool removed by the doffing knife from the cylinder of a carding machine.
To con or trick (someone) out of money.
To shear the fleece from (a sheep or other animal).
definitions.example: During spring shearing we have to fleece all the sheep in just a few days.

definitions.definition: To cover with, or as if with, wool.
A property of this kind.
Describing, or relating to a property bought as an investment, the purchaser letting it to others rather than living in it
A citrus fruit that is a cross between a tangerine and a pomelo or a grapefruit.
A red-orange colour, like that of a tangelo.
A movement that twists or pulls violently; a tug.
An injury caused by a violent twisting or pulling of a limb; strain, sprain.
A trick or artifice.
Deceit; guile; treachery.
A turn at an acute angle.
A winch or windlass.
A screw.
A distorting change from the original meaning.
A hand tool for making rotational adjustments, such as fitting nuts and bolts, or fitting pipes; a spanner.
An adjustable spanner used by plumbers.
A violent emotional change caused by separation.
In screw theory, a screw assembled from force and torque vectors arising from application of Newton's laws to a rigid body.
Means; contrivance
In coursing, the act of bringing the hare round at less than a right angle, worth half a point in the recognised code of points for judging.
To violently move in a turn or writhe.
To pull or twist violently.
definitions.example: With a surge of adrenaline, she wrenched the car door off and pulled out the injured man.

definitions.definition: To turn aside or deflect.
To slander.
To tighten with or as if with a winch.
To injure (a joint) by pulling or twisting.
definitions.example: Be careful not to wrench your ankle walking along those loose stones!

definitions.definition: To distort from the original meaning.
To thrust a weapon in a twisting motion.
To disarm an opponent by whirling his or her blade away.
To rack with pain.
To deprive by means of a violent pull or twist.
To use the tool known as a wrench.
definitions.example: The plumber wrenched the pipes until they came loose.

definitions.definition: An area or expanse.
definitions.example: an unexplored tract of sea

definitions.definition: A series of connected body organs, as in the digestive tract.
A small booklet such as a pamphlet, often for promotional or informational uses.
A brief treatise or discourse on a subject.
A commentator's view or perspective on a subject.
Continued or protracted duration, length, extent

Part of the proper of the liturgical celebration of the Eucharist for many Christian denominations, used instead of the alleluia during Lenten or pre-Lenten seasons, in a Requiem Mass, and on a few other penitential occasions.
Continuity or extension of anything.
definitions.example: the tract of speech

definitions.definition: Traits; features; lineaments.
The footprint of a wild animal.
Track; trace.
Treatment; exposition.
To pursue, follow; to track.
To draw out; to protract.
Receiving others kindly and conversing with them in a free and friendly manner; friendly, courteous, sociable.
Mild; benign.
Covered in hair or bristles; hairy.
To remove the regulations, or legal restrictions, from.
A covering of liquid, particularly oil.
definitions.example: Careful in turn three — there's an oil slick on the road.

definitions.definition: Someone who is clever and untrustworthy.
A tool used to make something smooth or even.
A tire with a smooth surface instead of a tread pattern, often used in auto racing.
definitions.example: You'll go much faster if you put on slicks.

definitions.definition: A helicopter.
A camera-ready image to be used by a printer. The "slick" is photographed to produce a negative image which is then used to burn a positive offset plate or other printing device.
definitions.example: The project was delayed because the slick had not been delivered to the printer.

definitions.definition: A wide paring chisel used in joinery.
To make slick.
definitions.example: The surface had been slicked.

definitions.definition: Slippery or smooth due to a covering of liquid; often used to describe appearances.
definitions.example: His large round head was shaved slick.

definitions.definition: Appearing expensive or sophisticated.
definitions.example: They read all kinds of slick magazines.

definitions.definition: Superficially convincing but actually untrustworthy.
definitions.example: That new sales rep is slick. Be sure to read the fine print before you buy anything.

definitions.definition: (often used sarcastically) Clever, making an apparently hard task easy.
definitions.example: Our new process for extracting needles from haystacks is extremely slick.

definitions.definition: Extraordinarily great or special.
definitions.example: That is one slick bicycle: it has all sorts of features!

definitions.definition: Sleek; smooth
The finer portion of crushed ore, as of gold, lead, or tin, separated by the water in certain wet processes.
A marchioness, especially one who is French.
A marquee.
(jewelry) An oval cut diamond with pointed ends.
A canopy, usually of glass, set as a shelter over a door opening onto a terrace or pavement.
A style of parasol of the mid-19th century.
A rich dessert made with dark chocolate, butter, sugar, cocoa powder, eggs and cream.
An act or instance of appropriating.
That which is appropriated.
Public funds set aside for a specific purpose.
The use of borrowed elements in the creation of a new work.
The assimilation of concepts into a governing framework.
In church law, the making over of a benefice to an owner who receives the tithes, but is bound to appoint a vicar for the spiritual service of the parish.
In constitutional law, the principle that supplies granted by parliament are only to be expended for particular objects specified by itself.
A small explosive device, designed to be thrown by hand or launched from a grenade launcher.
A pomegranate.
A charge similar to a fireball, and made of a disc-shaped bomb shell, but with only one set of flames at the top.
An unattractive girl.
To use grenade(s) upon.
An inhabitant/citizen of Caesarea.
A Caesarean section.
A hard, full-fat Italian cheese from Parma.
(by extension) A similar cheese produced elsewhere.
Money.
(history) A period of European history, extending over several decades until the start of the First World War, characterized by artistic and cultural refinement.
A large ballistic projectile made of or coated with rubber that has a propellant charge, typically used for riot control.
A representation of the nativity scene.
A hospital for orphaned infants; a foundling hospital.
A day nursery.
A group of young who stay together for protection.
A disease of the retina of the eye resulting in loss of central vision.
The process of bringing a new employee on board, incorporating training and orientation.
Conforming to the accepted, established, or traditional doctrines of a given faith, religion, or ideology.
Adhering to whatever is customary, traditional, or generally accepted.
Of pollen, seed, or spores: viable for a long time; viable when dried to low moisture content.
A light thermoplastic used in packaging etc.; polyethylene.
Having self-respect; having pride or knowledge of one's own worth.
definitions.example: No self-respecting man would tolerate such an insult.

definitions.definition: A confidence trickster.
A small, snug room which may be used as a place of privacy and safety by children
A small compartment; a pigeonhole
A glove compartment
The atmosphere of the Earth and the region of space around it.
The industry concerned with aircraft, missiles, satellites and spacecraft.
Of, or relating to the Earth's atmosphere and nearby space.
Of, or relating to the science, technology and industry associated with aircraft, missiles, satellites and spacecraft.
A person who is skilled at geology.
A system formed by an ecological community and its environment that functions as a unit.
The interconnectedness of organisms (plants, animals, microbes) with each other and their environment.
A set of interconnected products and services.
A common childhood disease caused by the varicella zoster virus (VZV), Human alphaherpesvirus 3 (HHV-3).
A son of one's child.
To make a pledge to (someone); to promise, guarantee (someone of something); to assure.
To make sure or certain of something (usually some future event or condition).
definitions.example: I use an alarm clock to ensure that I get up on time.

definitions.definition: To provide for compensation if some specified risk occurs. Often agreed by policy (contract) to offer financial compensation in case of an accident, theft or other undesirable event.
definitions.example: I'm not insured against burglary.

definitions.definition: To deal in such contracts; subscribe to a policy of insurance
To descend into a body of water; to founder.
definitions.example: the boat was too heavy and went under.

definitions.definition: To collapse or fail, e.g. by going bankrupt.
definitions.example: In the crisis, the company was forced to reduce its costs in order to avoid going under.

definitions.definition: To be named; to call oneself.
definitions.example: He goes under the name of Mr X to remain anonymous.

definitions.definition: To enter a state of hypnosis.
A weblog using video as its primary presentation format.
To contribute to a video weblog.
To post (something) to a video weblog.
Either of a pair of small masses of lymphoid tissue that lie on each side of the throat and that help protect the body against infection; palatine tonsil.
Any of various small masses of lymphoid tissues, including palatine tonsils, adenoids and lingual tonsils.
A unit of volume, equivalent to:
(metonym) A pint of milk.
definitions.example: Please leave three pints tomorrow, milkman.

definitions.definition: (metonymy) A glass of beer or cider, served by the pint.
The moon in its first or last quarter when only half the visible face is illuminated; a quarter moon.
Anything shaped like a crescent, especially the base of a fingernail.
A slum or shantytown, especially in Brazil
To figure something out; to deduce or discern something.
definitions.example: We didn't tell our friends that we were dating, but I think they put two and two together.

definitions.definition: Having an irreversible loss of brain function and cessation of brain activity.
Having no useful thoughts; stupid; ditzy.
A type of residential tenement building found in India, typically for poor working-class people.
A church with an atypically large congregation.
An organizational structure of the government of a state, church, etc.
A politically organized unit; a state.
definitions.example: Different nations have different forms of polities, from provinces and states to territories and municipalities.

definitions.definition: That which is suitable for compost.
Suitable for compost.
A literal or metaphorical force or object regarded as unstoppable, that will crush all in its path.
(sometimes derogatory) A large, cumbersome truck or lorry, especially an artic.
An institution that incites destructive devotion or to which people are carelessly sacrificed.
A prisoner's release from prison for set hours so he or she can work.
A humped back (deformity in humans caused by abnormal curvature of the upper spine).
A person with a humpback; a person who suffers from kyphosis.
A humpback whale.
A humpback salmon.
To hunt humpback whales.
Any of many minute arachnids which, along with the ticks, comprise subclass Acarina (aka Acari).
A small coin formerly circulated in England, rated at about a third of a farthing.
A lepton, a small coin used in Palestine in the time of Christ.
A small weight; one twentieth of a grain.
(sometimes used adverbially) Anything very small; a minute object; a very little quantity or particle
(often used affectionately) A small or naughty person, or one you take pity on; rascal
A health care practitioner who specializes in the diagnosis and treatment of foot ailments.
definitions.example: I visited my podiatrist to get a new pair of orthopedic inserts for my sneakers.

definitions.definition: Sexual attractiveness.
definitions.example: He may be as thick as a plank, but he sure has some sex appeal.

definitions.definition: The process or result of jump-starting a motor vehicle.
definitions.example: I left my headlights on all night. Could you give me a jump-start?

definitions.definition: To start a motor vehicle by passing an electrical current from a charged battery to the discharged ("dead" or "flat") battery of the vehicle being started, by using booster cables to temporarily connect the two batteries in parallel.
To reactivate or rejuvenate.
definitions.example: Giving a really good speech at the convention could jump-start her political career.

definitions.definition: A straight line painted on the side of a road, to indicate that parking is restricted
Not auspicious; ill-omened
The act of abrogating; a repeal by authority; abolition.
Any of various dark-coloured Asian species of papilionid butterflies of the genus Papilio.
A worthless person; a hooligan or lout.
A pimp.
A person who drives excessively quickly, loudly or irresponsibly; a street drag racer often driving heavily customized cars.
An attempt or go at something.
To act loutishly; specifically, to drive excessively quickly, loudly or irresponsibly.
To make a hooting or howling sound.
A unit of weight (about 0.378125 of a gram, or 0.0133 of an ounce) used to measure opium in British-controlled parts of Asia; a candareen.
A pagoda, a type of gold coin.
The office of bishop and the governance of the Church by bishops.
Bishops collectively; episcopate.
Any of various styles of light popular music.
A person who resists; especially a member of a resistance movement.
A thing which resists.
Which makes resistance or offers opposition.
Which is not affected or overcome by a disease, drug, chemical or atmospheric agent, extreme of temperature, etc.
definitions.example: The infection is resistant to antibiotics.

definitions.definition: Not greatly influenced by individual members of a sample.
Lacking courage; timid

Any of a series of red, irregular stripes on the surface of the skin caused by rapid growth of the tissues lying just underneath. They usually appear as a result of pregnancy, puberty or obesity, but can also be caused by rapid muscle growth.
A substance that acts to increase physiological or nervous activity in the body.
Something that promotes activity, interest, or enthusiasm.
(pharmaceutical effect) Acting as a stimulant.
A person who advocates populism (a movement against ruling elites who are presumed not to act in the interests of the ordinary citizen).
A politician who advocates specific policies just because they are popular.
A person who advocates democratic principles.
Democratic.
(of a political policy) Put forward just because it would be popular.
Of or pertaining to populism.
Any compound having a specified (range of) molecular weight(s)
Relating to, or consisting of, or produced by molecules.
(of an element) Combined with itself and with no other element; elemental.
Relating to a simple or basic structure or organization.
Relating to molecular gastronomy.
definitions.example: molecular dishes

definitions.definition: The horizontal member protruding from the base of a window frame
A cubic curve.
Used in the names of units of volume formed by multiplying a unit of length by itself twice.
definitions.example: cubic foot

definitions.definition: Of a class of polynomial of the form ax^3 + bx^2 + cx + d
Having three equal axes and all angles 90°.
definitions.example: cubic cleavage

definitions.definition: In the tourist industry, the period of highest demand. In a sun and sand resort this means the hottest months, whereas in a ski resort, this means the coldest months.
The top stone of an arch.
Something on which other things depend for support.
A native or resident of the American state of Pennsylvania.
(retail) A retail price that is double the cost price; a markup of 100%.
The combination of the shortstop and second baseman.
To distort (an image) by projecting it onto a surface at an angle, which for example causes a square to look like a trapezoid.
(retail) To double the cost price in order to determine the retail price; to apply a markup of 100%.
The first decade of a century: from 1900 to 1909, 2000 to 2009, etc.
The European species Sorbus aucuparia, commonly known as rowan or more specifically European rowan.
definitions.example: 2007, Tyler Guthrie, Mountain Ash: Formally Rowan Tree, Trinity College, Academic Dissertation.

definitions.definition: Any of several trees in the genus Sorbus in North America.
A tree native to southeastern Australia, Eucalyptus regnans, the tallest of all flowering plants.
A Texan ash tree species, Fraxinus texensis.
A dog, particularly a breed with a good sense of smell developed for hunting other animals.
Any canine animal.
(by extension) Someone who seeks something.
(by extension) A male who constantly seeks the company of desirable women.
A despicable person.
A houndfish.
To persistently harass.
definitions.example: He hounded me for weeks, but I was simply unable to pay back his loan.

definitions.definition: To urge on against; to set (dogs) upon in hunting.
(in the plural) Projections at the masthead, serving as a support for the trestletrees and top to rest on.
A side bar used to strengthen portions of the running gear of a vehicle.
A warm one-piece garment worn while sleeping.

A semi-aquatic, egg-laying monotreme mammal with a bill resembling that of a duck, that has a mole-like body, a tail resembling that of a beaver, a waterproof pelt, and flat webbed feet — males have poisonous spurs on the inside of the back legs; Ornithorhynchus anatinus
To make more specific.
definitions.example: After consulting with witnesses, the police narrowed down the suspects to those who had facial hair.

definitions.definition: The art of steering.
The section of a passenger ship that provided inexpensive accommodation with no individual cabins.
The effect of the helm on a ship.

A fretted stringed instrument of European origin, similar to the guitar, having a bowl-shaped body or soundbox; any of a wide variety of chordophones with a pear-shaped body and a neck whose upper surface is in the same plane as the soundboard, with strings along the neck and parallel to the soundboard.
To play on a lute, or as if on a lute.
Thick sticky clay or cement used to close up a hole or gap, especially to make something air-tight.
A packing ring, as of rubber, for fruit jars, etc.
(brickmaking) A straight-edged piece of wood for striking off superfluous clay from earth.
To fix or fasten something with lute.

A belief in a coming religious millennium, especially the belief in a coming thousand-year reign of peace heralded by the Second Coming of Christ; utopianism, belief in a coming era of peace and prosperity.
A spiced dish of rice, blended with meat and/or vegetables.
